intro: Galeopsis speciosa, commonly known as the showy horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, branching stems that grow up to 1 meter in height, covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and serrated, often with a slightly hairy texture. Galeopsis speciosa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in herbal remedies.
